p: Despite most patients infected with subtype B were Spanish natives (579 Spaniards vs 199 foreigners), a majority of those infected with non-B variants were foreigners (58 vs 113; FET: p-value < 2.2 × 10 −16, OR = 5.66, 95% CI = 3.91–8.23). This difference was also observed when considering only patients belonging to a transmission cluster (subtype B: 378 vs 114; non-B: 31 vs 47; FET: p-value = 1.8 × 10 −10; OR = 5.01, 95% CI = 2.96–8.57) (Supplementary Table S1).
